name: Inspired design and costume sketches
description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

key_work.title: Inspired design and costume sketches
key_work.brief_description: Costume designers don’t always rely on sketches of their creations. True History of the Kelly Gang designer Alice Babidge sketches to distil references, while Judy & Punch designer Edie Kurzer gets more inspiration from objects.

constellations_primary.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_primary.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

start.title: Inspired design and costume sketches
start.brief_description: Costume designers don’t always rely on sketches of their creations. True History of the Kelly Gang designer Alice Babidge sketches to distil references, while Judy & Punch designer Edie Kurzer gets more inspiration from objects.

constellations_primary.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_primary.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

end.title: Judy & Punch
end.creator_credit: Edie Kurzer, Danny Gabai, Michele Bennett, Nash Edgerton, Create NSW, Pariah Productions, Screen Australia, Soundfirm, VICE Media and Mirrah Foulkes
end.brief_description: In the anarchic town of Seaside, nowhere near the sea, puppeteers Judy and Punch are trying to resurrect their marionette show. The show is a hit due to Judy’s superior puppeteering but Punch’s driving ambition and penchant for whisky lead to an inevitable tragedy that Judy must avenge.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge.

constellations_other.name: True blue, true crime
constellations_other.description: Robert Connolly's The Dry is a recent Australian crime blockbuster, but the writer, director and producer's first film (and first crime film) connects to a longstanding tradition of true-blue crime stories from some of our greatest filmmakers.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

links.description: Costume designer Edie Kurzer’s sketches and inspiration for Judy and Punch are displayed in The Story of the Moving Image. Kurzer often explores mood and atmosphere with images instead of using them as direct influences and also finds inspiration in objects.

start.title: Judy & Punch
start.creator_credit: Edie Kurzer, Danny Gabai, Michele Bennett, Nash Edgerton, Create NSW, Pariah Productions, Screen Australia, Soundfirm, VICE Media and Mirrah Foulkes
start.brief_description: In the anarchic town of Seaside, nowhere near the sea, puppeteers Judy and Punch are trying to resurrect their marionette show. The show is a hit due to Judy’s superior puppeteering but Punch’s driving ambition and penchant for whisky lead to an inevitable tragedy that Judy must avenge.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge.

constellations_other.description: Robert Connolly's The Dry is a recent Australian crime blockbuster, but the writer, director and producer's first film (and first crime film) connects to a longstanding tradition of true-blue crime stories from some of our greatest filmmakers.

constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

end.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock
end.brief_description: Valentine’s Day, 1900. Three schoolgirls and their governess mysteriously disappear in Hanging Rock, Australia, without a trace.

constellations_other.name: Clothing, country, character
constellations_other.description: Edie Kurzer's costume design work on Judy & Punch and Picnic at Hanging Rock is part of a larger trend in Australian films and TV series.

constellations_other.name: Teenage dreams
constellations_other.description: Puberty Blues realistically represents the trials and tribulations of Australian adolescence. Since then a diverse range of originals and remakes offer new perspectives on teen dreams.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

links.description: Before working on Judy & Punch, Edie Kurzer designed costumes for the TV series adaptation of Picnic at Hanging Rock.

start.title: True History of the Kelly Gang
start.creator_credit: Alice Babidge, Brad Feinstein, Hal Vogel and Liz Watts
start.brief_description: True History of the Kelly Gang is a 2019 British-Australian biographical western film based on the exploits of Australia’s famous outlaw, Ned Kelly. It’s directed by Justin Kurzel, from a screenplay by Shaun Grant, based upon the 2000 novel of the same name by Peter Carey.

constellations_primary.name: The Australian industry
constellations_primary.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge.

constellations_primary.name: Alice Babidge and True History of the Kelly Gang
constellations_primary.description: An acclaimed set, costume, and production designer in the world of theatre, Alice Babidge has most recently been working in film including Justin Kurzel features Snowtown and True History Of The Kelly Gang.

constellations_other.name: Pink, Pose, punk, Pilgrim
constellations_other.description: Alice Babidge's costume design for True History of the Kelly Gang sees the iconic foursome and their accomplices in dresses, a gender-expansive stance that connects to other rebellious outlooks on the world.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

end.title: The Favourite
end.creator_credit: Ceci Dempsey, Ed Guiney, Lee Magiday and Yorgos Lanthimos
end.headline_credit: Ireland, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018

video_links.name: THE FAVOURITE | Official Trailer | FOX Searchlight

end.brief_description: England, early 18th century. The close relationship between Queen Anne and Sarah Churchill is threatened by the arrival of Sarah’s cousin, Abigail Hill, resulting in a bitter rivalry between the two cousins to be the Queen’s favourite.

constellations_primary.name: Auteurs and Yorgos Lanthimos
constellations_primary.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

constellations_other.name: Creating characters with Great costumes
constellations_other.description: Emma Fryer's costume design for The Great took inspiration from both accurate finery of the period, and contemporary designs of fashion houses like Dior. The resulting costumes evolve with the characters.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge.

constellations_other.name: Dress to impress
constellations_other.description: In The Great, Peter and Catherine’s costumes during their Dacha visit are designed to demonstrate their unity, as they negotiate with the Swedish royals. Clothes have long been a way to communicate power, particularly in politics.

constellations_other.name: Power and privilege, monarchy and make-up
constellations_other.description: The upper echelons of society explored through colour, make-up and scandal.

constellations_other.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_other.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

constellations_other.name: Making films in black and white
constellations_other.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

links.description: Costume designer Alice Babidge got her start at Sydney Theatre Company, where she was mentored by Fiona Crombie, production designer on The Favourite.

start.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock
start.brief_description: Valentine’s Day, 1900. Three schoolgirls and their governess mysteriously disappear in Hanging Rock, Australia, without a trace.

constellations_other.description: Edie Kurzer's costume design work on Judy & Punch and Picnic at Hanging Rock is part of a larger trend in Australian films and TV series.

end.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock
end.creator_credit: Hal McElroy, Jim McElroy and Cliff Green

video_links.name: Peter Weir on Picnic at Hanging Rock

end.brief_description: Peter Weir’s Australian New Wave classic about a group of students who mysteriously disappear as an eerie but scenic volcanic formation called Hanging Rock.

constellations_other.name: Clothing, country, character
constellations_other.description: Edie Kurzer's costume design work on Judy & Punch and Picnic at Hanging Rock is part of a larger trend in Australian films and TV series.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

links.description: The TV series of Picnic at Hanging Rock is a direct adaptation of the same novel as Peter Weir’s iconic 1975 film version.

start.title: The Babadook
start.brief_description: A single mother, plagued by the death of her husband, battles with her son’s fear of a monster lurking in the house, but soon discovers a sinister presence all around her in this acclaimed debut from Jennifer Kent.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge.

constellations_other.name: Optical toys, Totoro and terrors
constellations_other.description: Victorian-era optical toys have inspired the biggest animation studios and the scariest horror films.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

end.title: The Nightingale
end.creator_credit: Bruna Papandrea, Jennifer Kent, Kristina Ceyton, Steve Hutensky, Adelaide Film Festival Investment Fund, Creative Wealth Media Finance, FilmNation Entertainment, Made Up Stories, Screen Australia, Screen Tasmania, South Australian Film Corporation, David Smith and Evans Mark
end.headline_credit: Australia, Canada and United States of America, 2019
end.brief_description: In 1825, Claire, a young Irish convict, enlists an Indigenous tracker to chase a British soldier through the rugged Tasmanian wilderness, bent on revenge for a terrible act of violence he committed against her family.

constellations_other.name: David Dalaithngu
constellations_other.description: David Dalaithngu was a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Dalaithngu was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

links.description: Director Jennifer Kent followed up her iconic horror debut The Babadook with moody chase revenge film The Nightingale.

constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

links.description: True History of the Kelly Gang stars Babadook lead, and Australian legend, Essie Davis as Ellen Kelly.

end.title: Sweet Country
end.creator_credit: Warwick Thornton, Heather Wallace, David Jowsey, Greer Simpkin, Bunya Productions, Tony Cronin, David Tranter and Steven McGregor
end.brief_description: It’s 1929 on the vast, desert-like, Eastern Arrernte Nation lands that are now known as the Central Australian outback. Sam Kelly, a middle-aged Aboriginal man, works the land of a kind preacher, Fred Smith. After an ill-tempered bully arrives in town and Kelly kills him in self-defence, he and his wife go on the run as a posse gathers to hunt him down.

constellations_primary.name: Sweet Country
constellations_primary.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

constellations_other.name: David Dalaithngu
constellations_other.description: David Dalaithngu was a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Dalaithngu was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge.

constellations_other.name: Crime doesn't pay
constellations_other.description: Ned Kelly's famous armour has appeared in many films, but the criminal myth speaks to how audiences have always been captivated by true-crime stories, from the beginning of cinema to today.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

links.description: Because of the size of the Australian film and TV industry, production crew often find themselves working together. This happened to costume designer Heather Wallace and set decorator Jennifer Drake, who worked together on both of these films.

start.title: Inspired design and costume sketches
start.brief_description: Costume designers don’t always rely on sketches of their creations. True History of the Kelly Gang designer Alice Babidge sketches to distil references, while Judy & Punch designer Edie Kurzer gets more inspiration from objects.

constellations_other.description: Alice Babidge's costume design for True History of the Kelly Gang sees the iconic foursome and their accomplices in dresses, a gender-expansive stance that connects to other rebellious outlooks on the world.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

links.description: Rather than draw what the finished costume should look like, True History of the Kelly Gang costume designer Alice Babidge uses sketches to distil various reference images into one thought. For Babidge, drawing helps “refine an idea”.

start.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock
start.brief_description: Valentine’s Day, 1900. Three schoolgirls and their governess mysteriously disappear in Hanging Rock, Australia, without a trace.

end.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock purple fete and mourning dress design materials
end.brief_description: Mrs Appleyard’s purple fete outfit was fabricated from scratch, while the reference materials illustrate some of the details that went into Edie Kurzer’s garment design. The costume sketch and mood board show how Kurzer gathered a body of historical reference points while crafting the original garments.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

links.description: Edie Kurzer’s design materials, including costume sketches, mood boards and continuity photos have been displayed alongside the iconic costumes in The Story of the Moving Image.
